trans-unit.source: Exception that indicates an error occurred loading the property value from the data service.
The caller should inspect <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQueryException.Response%2A> to get the exception results.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQueryException"></xref> class with a system-supplied message that describes the error.
This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error.
This message takes into account the current system culture.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.InsufficientMemoryException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The localized error message string.|
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQueryException"></xref> class with a specified message that describes the error.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQueryException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The error message string specified in `message`.|
The message that describes the exception.
The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
To be added.
To be added.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQueryException"></xref> class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or `null` if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQueryException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The error message string specified in `message`.|
The message that describes the exception.
The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.

If the `innerException` parameter is not <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, the current exception is raised in a <xref uid="langword_csharp_catch" name="catch" href=""></xref> block that handles the inner exception.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQueryException"></xref> class.
The string value that contains the error message.
The inner exception object.
The <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.QueryOperationResponse"></xref> object.
Gets the <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.QueryOperationResponse"></xref> that indicates the exception results.
A <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.QueryOperationResponse"></xref> object that indicates the exception results.
